page.title: 04Religion
page.content: The majority of villagers are C. ofE.with a few Methodists, family of Quakers, (who meet in Penrith), and only l admitted agnostic.The peaceful sandstone church is situated 1/2 mile west of the village.It was built in the l2th century and renovated every century the last time being 1894.The door is left open; approx. 35 people per year visit and sign the book to admire the simple interior with l2 stained glass windows and 2 bells.110 people on the register, with an average of about 30 people attend a variety of services.The earliest grave stone is l300 a.d. Approx. 1 Wedding, l Christening,1 Burial occur each year.The Chapel in the village was built in l854 out of sandstone.It has 20 pews and is rarely used.
